title: Fork And Spoon, ca. 1600–30
markings: On shoulder of fork: embellished "N" within oval contour, flattened on top
creditline: The Robert L. Metzenberg Collection, gift of Eleanor L. Metzenberg
description: Two-tined fork with sloping shoulder; gilded neck elaborately decorated with leaves, masks and scrollwork; slightly curved handle of red coral, carved with a grotesque head on the front, surmounted by a torso and head of a man wearing a helmet; back of handle carved in decorative pattern. Spoon with oval bowl, gilded neck elaborately decorated with leaves, masks and scrollwork; slightly curving handle of red coral, carved with a grotesque head on the front, above the upper body of a woman holding a ewer in one hand and an urn in the other, as if pouring liquid from one into the other; back of handle has decorative pattern.

tombstone.epitaph:
Fork And Spoon, ca. 1600–30.
ca. 1600–30. Coral, silver, gilding. The Robert L. Metzenberg Collection, gift of Eleanor L. Metzenberg. 1985-103-81/82.
